data.enText: modern popular music of the sort that has been popular since the 1950s, usually with a strong rhythm and simple tunes

data.chText: 摇滚乐、流行音乐和灵乐

data.enText: used as a word for ‘father’, especially as a form of address

data.chText: 软木塞砰的一声从瓶口迸了出来。
data.enText: The cork came out of the bottle with a loud pop.
a sweet fizzy drink (= with bubbles) that is not alcoholic
to attack sb physically or in words
costing a particular amount for each one
to make a short explosive sound; to cause sth to make this sound

data.chText: 瓶塞被拔起时发出的砰砰声

data.enText: to burst, or make sth burst, with a short explosive sound

data.chText: 有人在她背后弄爆了一个气球，把她吓了一跳。
data.enText: She jumped as someone popped a balloon behind her.
to go somewhere quickly, suddenly or for a short time
I'll pop over and see you this evening.

data.chText: 下次来到这一带时，就到我们这儿小酌一杯如何？
data.enText: Why don't you pop in (= visit us) for a drink next time you're in the area?
to put sth somewhere quickly, suddenly or for a short time

data.chText: 他从门后探一探头，打了声招呼。
data.enText: He popped his head around the door and said hello.

data.chText: 我在回家时，顺便把书送过去吧。
data.enText: I'll pop the books in (= deliver them) on my way home.

data.chText: （让人意外地）突然出现；冷不防冒出
data.enText: to suddenly appear, especially when not expected

data.chText: 窗子打开了，冷不防一只狗探出头来。
data.enText: The window opened and a dog's head popped out.

data.chText: 他突然想到了一个主意。
data.enText: An idea suddenly popped into his head.

data.chText: 双击鼠标，选单便会弹出来。
data.enText: The menu pops up when you click twice on the mouse.

data.chText: （乘飞机等升高或降低时）耳压变化；（耳）胀
data.enText: if your ears pop when you are going up or down in a plane, etc., the pressure in them suddenly changes
if your eyes pop or pop out , they suddenly open fully because you are surprised or excited

data.chText: 她一看到他们，眼睛瞪得快要掉出来了。
data.enText: Her eyes nearly popped out of her head when she saw them.
to take a lot of a drug, regularly

data.chText: 她大量服药已有几个月了。
data.enText: She's been popping pills for months.

data.chText: 翘辫子；上西天；一命呜呼

data.enText: to ask sb to marry you
to put on a piece of clothing

data.chText: 我套件毛衣就出来见你。
data.enText: I'll just pop on a sweater and meet you outside.
to turn on a piece of electrical equipment

data.chText: 流行音乐的；通俗风格的
流行音乐乐队 / 组合

data.enText: made in a modern popular style
to burst or explode with a sudden short sound

means: (= printing-out paper ) (利用光照直接显影的)印相纸

data.enText: to attack sb physically or in words
costing a particular amount for each one

data.chText: 翘辫子；上西天；一命呜呼

data.enText: to ask sb to marry you
to burst or explode with a sudden short sound
to put on a piece of clothing

data.chText: 我套件毛衣就出来见你。
data.enText: I'll just pop on a sweater and meet you outside.
to turn on a piece of electrical equipment

tr: music of general appeal to teenagers
a bland watered-down version of rock'n'roll with more rhythm and harmony and an emphasis on romantic love
a sharp explosive sound as from a gunshot or drawing a cork
a sweet drink containing carbonated water and flavoring
example: in New England they call sodas tonics

tr: an informal term for a father
probably derived from baby talk
burst open with a sharp, explosive sound
example: The balloon popped
This popcorn pops quickly in the microwave oven

tr: cause to burst with a loud, explosive sound
example: The child popped the balloon

tr: fire a weapon with a loud explosive noise
example: The soldiers were popping

tr: take drugs, especially orally
example: The man charged with murder popped a valium to calm his nerves

tr: drink down entirely
example: He downed three martinis before dinner
She killed a bottle of brandy that night
They popped a few beer after work

tr: hit or strike
example: He popped me on the head

tr: hit a pop-fly
example: He popped out to shortstop

tr: release suddenly
example: pop the clutch

tr: put or thrust suddenly and forcefully
example: pop the pizza into the microwave oven
He popped the petit-four into his mouth

tr: bulge outward
example: His eyes popped

tr: appear suddenly or unexpectedly
example: The farm popped into view as we turned the corner
He suddenly popped up out of nowhere

tr: make a sharp explosive noise
example: The cork of the champagne bottle popped

tr: cause to make a sharp explosive sound
example: He popped the champagne bottle

tr: (of music or art) new and of general appeal (especially among young people)
like a pop or with a pop
example: everything went pop

value.def: Pop is modern music that usually has a strong rhythm and uses electronic equipment.

example.ex: ...the perfect combination of Caribbean rhythms, European pop, and American soul...
example.tran: 加勒比海韵律、欧洲流行音乐和美国灵乐的完美结合

example.ex: Which great British pop band had a hit with 'In the Army Now'?
example.tran: 英国哪一支伟大的流行乐队以一曲《正在服役》风靡一时？

example.ex: ...a life-size poster of a pop star...
example.tran: 一位流行歌星的等身海报

example.ex: I know nothing about pop music.
example.tran: 我对流行音乐一无所知。

value.def: You can refer to fizzy drinks such as lemonade as pop .

example.ex: He still visits the village shop for buns and fizzy pop.
example.tran: 他仍然去村里的小店买小圆面包和汽水。

value.boxr_value: in AM, usually use 美国英语通常用 soda pop

value.def: Pop is used to represent a short sharp sound, for example the sound made by bursting a balloon or by pulling a cork out of a bottle.

example.ex: Each corn kernel will make a loud pop when cooked...
example.tran: 每粒玉米在烹制时都会发出很响的啪的一声。

example.ex: His back tyre just went pop on a motorway.
example.tran: 他的后胎在高速公路上砰的一声爆了。

value.def: If something pops, it makes a short sharp sound.

example.ex: He untwisted the wire off the champagne bottle, and the cork popped and shot to the ceiling.
example.tran: 他拧掉香槟瓶上的铁丝封口，瓶塞砰的一声直冲天花板。

value.def: If your eyes pop, you look very surprised or excited when you see something.

example.ex: My eyes popped at the sight of the rich variety of food on show.
example.tran: 看到展示的花样繁多的食品，我的眼睛都瞪圆了。

value.tran: （眼睛因惊讶、激动等而）瞪出，鼓出

value.def: If you pop something somewhere, you put it there quickly.

example.ex: Marianne got a couple of mugs from the dresser and popped a teabag into each of them...
example.tran: 玛丽安娜从碗橱拿了几个杯子，在每个杯中迅速地放入茶包。

example.ex: He plucked a purple grape from the bunch and popped it in his mouth.
example.tran: 他从葡萄串上摘下一颗紫葡萄，往嘴里一塞。

value.def: If you pop somewhere, you go there for a short time.

example.ex: He does pop down to the pub, but he seldom stays longer than an hour...
example.tran: 他确实会去酒馆小坐一下，但停留时间很少超过一小时。

example.ex: Wendy popped in for a quick bite to eat on Monday night.
example.tran: 温迪周一晚上过来匆匆吃了点儿饭。

example.ex: I looked at Pop and he had big tears in his eyes...
example.tran: 我看着爸爸，他眼睛里泪光盈盈。

example.ex: Yes, Pop, I made a big mistake — you and Mark made me realize that.
example.tran: 是的，爸爸，我犯了一个大错误，你和马克让我意识到了这一点。

value.boxr_value: in BRIT, usually use 英国英语通常用 dad

trans: 流行歌手；流行音乐歌手；流行歌星；流行乐歌手；流行歌曲歌手
(火,把火)突然灭掉；突然伸出；〔俚语〕(突然)死掉
波普艺术；通俗艺术；大众艺术(20世纪60年代兴起，以通俗文化为依托，以广告和电影形象等为素材)
